intro: Deppea tenuiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved deppea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Deppea tenuiflora is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
